ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2-3 hours
3 hours.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course provides some enlightening insight on a variety of sources of health disparities. That said, after taking "Psychosocial Epidemiology" the previous year, I did not learn too much new information.

A good course for anyone interested in learning about health disparities; however, may be more helpful for first-year students who have less exposure to this concept than for second-year students who have already covered much of this material in other classes
Great course, good content. Covered lots of material - perhaps a little more focused material would be nice.

This course was very interesting. I thought the topics we covered were interesting and the readings were helpful in understanding each topic.The class format was difficult however. I don't think people felt comfortable about opening up and talking about race in such a way that would make for a more fruitful discussion. I really appreciated Dr. Jones's honesty and her willingness to be open and forthright about her views. I think that helped a lot.I wonder if the first couple of the semester should start off with some kind of ice breaker activity that gets people comfortable to share their opinions.There was a tremendous amount of reading in this class that was at times difficult to keep up with.
Fair
This class was great, I enjoyed the discussion. The book club was great!
The course encourages great exchange among the students and instructor, however the readings were at times extensive.
Very good course with interesting readings. I enjoyed the life course perspective of the class.
The course consists of a wide range of topics related to health disparities, and the seminar model allows for interesting conversations.
I think Health Disparities was a very good class. I would have liked more discussion on the topics but I think that was more of an issue with the class being somewhat quiet.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Beth Jones  Professor Jones is a good teacher, and she cares about her students.
Instructor: Beth Jones  The instructor is articulate and engaging; the discussion-based style of the class is also great for this subject
Instructor: Beth Jones  Beth was great, very knowledgeable and passionate. I really appreciate that she mixed it up, and had us do the book report project.
Instructor: Beth Jones  Dr. Jones is a great instructor. She is very honest and open about her views which made the class format relaxed.
Instructor: Beth Jones  Fair
Instructor: Beth Jones  The instructor was great. She was very approachable.

Instructor: Beth Jones  Dr. Jones expertise in the area made for great discussion. The material she provided and required as background reading was useful in demonstrating the key points of each lecture.

Instructor: Beth Jones  Professor Jones brings both her perspective as a researcher and epidemiologist as well as her personal perspective to the class discussions, which makes for interesting and engaging conversations.

Instructor: Beth Jones  Dr. Jones is a great instructor. I really liked the spectrum of topics covered in the course and really loved the book club assignment. I would like to see this assignment earlier on in the class. I think it made the class a bit more talkative.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: N/A
N/A
N/A
N/A

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you don't have a great deal of background knowledge about health disparities, I would recommend this class.
A comprehensive general overview of patterns in health disparities
I would definitely recommend
This class was great. There needs to be more classes focusing on disparities in YSPH.
A terrific course and opportunity to examine and engage in discussion around racial-ethnic health disparities.
This course offers a great opportunity to focus on health disparities, an issue often referenced, but not usually discussed in detail, throughout other MPH courses.

This is a good course to take. Dr. Jones is very knowledgeable about disparities and you discuss a wide array of topics. The workload is fair and the book club is a nice break from the traditional academic readings.
